title.title: Northern line Charing Cross branch track closures

texts: Extensive track replacement work is planned on the Northern line's Charing Cross branch commencing in January 2007.
'Following completion of the renewal works, customers should experience an improvement in performance and reliability'
This will see weekend closures from Camden to Kennington on most weekends from 6 January to 9 April.
The essential track replacement is part of the upgrade of the Northern line.

The upgrade, due to be delivered by 2012, will include the installation of a new signalling system which, together with the new track, will deliver a faster, more frequent, and more reliable service for passengers.
The upgrade will cut journey times by an average of 18 per cent, and boost passenger capacity by 21 per cent.

Earlier this year, London Underground announced a major increase in the level of engineering work taking place on the Tube at weekends as part of Transport for London's £10 billion Investment Programme to improve and expand London's transport network.
The work on the Northern line is being undertaken by Tube Lines.
During the weekend work, there will be no service on the Northern line's Charing Cross branch between Camden Town and Kennington.
Passengers should also be aware of a reduced service on the rest of the Northern line.
Mornington Crescent and Goodge Streets stations will also be closed as they are not served by any other Underground line.

David Millard, General Manager, Northern line said: 'The extensive nature of these much needed track replacement works means that it is not possible for it to be undertaken during normal engineering hours and therefore a number of weekend closures are required.
'By carrying out the work at weekends we will limit the extent of customer disruption as fewer people are travelling.
'Following completion of the renewal works, customers should experience an improvement in performance and reliability on the Northern line.'
